attributes.action: Allow the people, the general public to decide their own laws after bexit
attributes.additional_details: We don't know now what laws will change now and how it will negatively affect the public this is why we need to have a say in our own laws, an idea that I have is that we send everyone on the electoral register a questonare on all the laws that are to be reviewed and ask for our opinion. I.e: Do you wish the law on fox hunting to be changed? Then 3 possible answers for the public to choose I.e: 1) leave unchanged 2) complete ban or 3) heavily regulated.
attributes.background: After Theresa Mays and the House of Commons shocking decision that animals in fact do not have feelings thus should be experimented on after exit is wholeheartedly a disgusting choice designed solely to further bulk the wealth of those currently in power.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We're not sure exactly what you want the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure whether you want there to be a UK referendum on all changes to the law, or only on some laws. 

You might also like to know that the House of Commons did not make a "decision that animals in fact do not have feelings thus should be experimented on after exit". 

You can find out more about this here:

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/CBP-8155

If you want the UK Government and Parliament to pass a new law to make animals legally "sentient beings" in UK law, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/205348
